--- kaakaila@... wrote:
> --- In junit@y..., Eric Vought <evought@q...> wrote:
> and
> --- In junit@y..., "J. B. Rainsberger"
> <jbrains762@h...> wrote:
> .....
> >Ladies and Gentlemen:
> >
> >I am frankly quite concerned with the quality of
> the exchanges 
> >going on here in the last several weeks. It appears
> that many 
> >people think there are "magic formulas" for working
> with JUnit. 
> >As a result, they ask silly questions like, "How do
> I test an 
> >EJB with JUnit????" The people who know the answer
> get so 
> >tired of writing, "Search this list. Try it. What
> are you
> >having trouble testing?" that they simply stop
> responding. 
> >As a result, questions are not being answered.
> ................
> 

I agree with this opinion....before posting any doubt
the concerned person should really try and then only
ask.

I asked that pariticular question(Y should i use
Junit?) yesterday after searching and reading all docs
including the framework.I didnt find any solid answer
for the same.
after that i thought there may be some real time
issues which i may not aware..'coz of that only i
posted that question.....
